column4: Please help. for more than a week now i have been having major issues with firefox. realised today that it deosn't matter what browser i install (opera epiphany) the same problem exists. browsers will randomly crash, doesn't matter what the content doesn't matter what the site. driving me nuts, cannot browse at all from my daily work production machine. pc at home is fine, also running intrepid 64, haven't run updates on it in a while though so there
do you have the flash plugin installed ?
I do do you know the flash is not the problem ?
becuase flashpluing not installed for opera or epiphany and safe mode does not work in ff either
uninstall the package gcjwebplugin
java is not installed by default, you installed it somehow
yes, that would install it
sudo apt-get remove --purge *java*
sudo apt-get remove --purge *java*  E: Regex compilation error - Invalid preceding regular expression
dpkg -l | grep  "^ii" | grep java
ok that didn't make a difference, problem is not java
it crashed ?
yup crashed just like b4\
have you launched the browser from the terminal ?
judging from your forum post, you have SEVERAL plugins installed
this happens with ALL browsers, not just FF
I dont know about opera, but probably epiphany does also loads plugins from /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins/
if i have uninstallled all plugins why does it still happen?
did you ? I see an mplayer plugin on your plugins list, was that uninstalled ?
ls /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins/
how can i completely uninstall all plugins?
those errors on that forum they don't always appear when FF or opera crashes, in most cases there are no errors
